intro: Stegolepis hitchcockii, commonly known as the Hitchcock's daisy. It is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The species belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces showy yellow flowers with white ray florets. Stegolepis hitchcockii is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments.
